Hey Matt,

I chose (0,0) as the coordinate for the single-node output layer=
.

I figured this is the most intuitive since all of the layers are
centere=
d around (0,0), but I don't know if putting the node at an
offset would cau=
se an increase/decrease in performance.

Jason G.

--- In neat@yahoogroups.=
com, "Matt Simmerson" <m.simmerson@...> wrote:
>
> Hi
> 
> Great paper, it =
has finally got me off my backside to put HyperNeat
> into neat4j as I have=
 tried to do exactly this, for Chess, using
> regular neat and alpha-beta p=
runing.  The best result I got was a draw
> with me (I am not a good player=
) and I wasn't really concentrating -
> so the fact that this did very well=
 against another, albeit, virtual
> player is fascinating
> 
> My question =
is about the 3rd layer, the single node, what co-ordinates
> do you feed in=
to the CPNN in conjuction with those that come from the
> hidden layer?  Al=
l the other co-ordinates make sense, I just need
> pointing in the right di=
rection.
> 
> Cheers
> 
> Matt
